[

Media, Manager

Company Name Arts Centre Melbourne Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 106 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

    • Full time ongoing role

    • Band 4.2.13 $93,388.74


Are you a proven leader in PR or corporate communications, driven by a passion for the subject matter and a desire to lead a talented and creative team to deliver outstanding results? Why not do it at Australia's largest and busiest performing arts centre?


About Arts Centre Melbourne


Situated in the heart of Melbourne’s cultural precinct, Arts Centre Melbourne presents world-class performing arts in an exciting year-round program. Experience Australia’s best performing arts companies and exceptional international productions, alongside celebrations of comedy, cabaret and popular music. \xa0


For a glimpse into Arts Centre Melbourne, click here.


The Business Unit


The Marketing and Communications team is responsible for the management of Arts Centre Melbourne’s Marketing, Online, Communications and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) services. The team coordinates the integrated planning and implementation of campaigns for external hirers and Arts Centre Melbourne presented programming. It also manages the coordination of marketing for tourism and complementary services including the membership and donors program, Sunday Market, food and beverage outlets and the car park. The Marketing and Communications team is the brand advocate for Arts Centre Melbourne and ensures that the brand reflects our vision and values.


The Business Unit is focused on increasing the profile and patronage of Arts Centre Melbourne and engaging a greater and more diverse range of audiences through the delivery of targeted and integrated marketing and publicity. Alignment with the Philanthropy, Ticketing and Visitor Experience teams aids in maintaining a consistency across the entire customer journey – through Arts Centre Melbourne’s owned, earned and paid channels.


The Communications team within Marketing and Communications is responsible for external and internal communications across the organisation, media and PR, issues management, publications as well as stakeholder events. This team will also lead on all public positioning, issues management and community and stakeholder engagement on the Arts Centre Melbourne component (Reimagining Arts Centre Melbourne) of the Victorian Government’s redevelopment of the Melbourne Arts Precinct.


About the Position


As the Media\xa0Manager you will be responsible\xa0for leading Arts Centre Melbourne's strategies for audience development, PR\xa0and brand awareness,\xa0providing expert mentorship to a team of two Media Advisors, and\xa0working in collaboration with the Marketing Campaign and Social teams to devise and deliver integrated PR/communications campaigns in support of Arts Centre Melbourne presents programming and as required to external hire/program presenters. The breadth of programming extends to the PR campaigns you would create and deliver in a dynamic and fast-paced environment – everything from families programming and contemporary music, through to circus, drama and musical theatre. This role will be integral in building audiences, supporting Arts Centre Melbourne's brand awareness, leveraging existing and building new and productive relationships in diverse media channels, and managing reputation.


To be successful you will require:


  • a tertiary qualification in communications, public relations and/or equivalent experience
  • extensive related experience in\xa0the cultural,\xa0arts, entertainment, or tourism sectors
  • demonstrated skills and experience in strategic planning for, and delivery of, a diversity of media coverage through a multiplicity of channels
  • experience in managing a high-performance, high-capacity team to achieve outstanding results
  • experience working across an organisation at a senior level, providing expert media and issue management advice to the senior team as required
  • adept skills at maintaining, nurturing and growing positive and productive stakeholder relationships
  • capacity to represent an organisation, and ability to create and articulate media strategies to a broad range of stakeholders.

Arts Centre Melbourne employees enjoy a range of benefits including:


  • opportunity to receive free house seats and complimentary tickets to our shows
  • organisational-wide learning and development and wellbeing programs
  • discounted commuter benefits and onsite car parking
  • access to health care insurance at competitive rates
  • food and beverage discounts at our staff café and surrounding restaurants.

Applications


Interested applicants must address the key criteria in their cover letter and submit it together with a current resume as one combined document. Please refer to the position description below\xa0on\xa0our website\xa0for further information, including the key criteria.


To submit your application, click on the Apply button below by\xa0Sunday 28 October 2018.


Applications are open to those with full-working rights in Australia


Arts Centre Melbourne is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer


\xa0Position Description - Media Manager September 2018.pdf

Gymnastics Program Manager and Head Coach

Company Name Melbourne Girls Grammar Company Location 86 Anderson Street , South Yarra, VIC 3141, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Melbourne Girls Grammar, we believe that an exceptional education for life provides not only academic skills and attributes, but also emotional and physical wellbeing. Our sustained focus is therefore on making girls’ wellbeing central to the school experience.

\xa0

Our new world-class Artemis Centre – named after the mythical goddess who represents strength and good health – boasts state of the art facilities including a 25m swimming pool, multi-purpose court, Fitness Hub with gym equipment, dance and yoga studio, outdoor seating amphitheatre, Learning Commons and caf\xe9 with indoor/outdoor meeting spaces. Artemis enables us to provide programs including Artemis Gymnastics, Artemis Aquatics as well as Artemis Holiday Clinics and other resources that underpin our proactive approach to student wellbeing.

\xa0

Melbourne Girls Grammar is seeking a passionate and experienced professional to join the Artemis team as the Jump Start Gymnastics Program Manager and Head Coach. This position is responsible for the year-round operation and promotion of the MGGS Jump Start Gymnastics Program, which includes managing the “Gymnastics for All” and “KinderGym” programs as well as providing quality coaching and instruction to MGGS students and the wider community.

\xa0

The primary purpose of the MGGS Jump Start Gymnastics Program is to inspire all students to lead a physically active and healthy life by teaching them fundamental movement skills in a fun, safe, inclusive and enjoyable space. The Jump Start Gymnastics Manager and Head Coach will be responsible for leading the continued growth and development of these aims.

\xa0

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Managing and carrying out the daily operation of the Jump Start Gymnastics Program;
  • Providing high quality gymnastics coaching;
  • Managing and mentoring the cohort of casual gymnastics coaches, including recruitment when required;
  • Collaborating with relevant groups to assist with meeting curriculum requirements;
  • Assisting with the promotion and marketing of Program information to internal and external communities;

\xa0

The successful candidate will have:

  • Minimum Intermediate Level Gymnastics Coaching accreditation;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ gymnastics coaching experience;
  • Demonstrated experience managing a gymnastics program or similar;
  • A passion for gymnastics and providing opportunities and positive experiences for children to get involved;
  • Strong organisational skills, a customer service orientation and flexibility with working hours;
  • Current Gymnastics Australia Technical Membership;
  • Current Senior First Aid and CPR Certificate; and
  • Current Victorian Working with Children Check
  • has zero tolerance for child abuse
  • actively works to listen to and empower children
  • has systems to protect children from abuse, and will take all allegations and concerns very seriously and responds to them consistently in line with the organisation's policies and procedures
  • is committed to promoting physical, emotional and cultural safety for all children
  • is committed to providing a safe environment for all children

\xa0

Please view the Position Description for further details about this role.

\xa0

Employment with Melbourne Girls Grammar is subject to school policies including the Child Safety Policy, Child Safety Code of Conduct and Child Safety Statement as listed below.

\xa0

Child Safety Statement: Melbourne Girls Grammar

\xa0

How to Apply

Applicants must hold or prior to commencing employment or be willing to obtain a current and valid Victorian Working with Children's Check.

\xa0

Applications close: 5.00pm, Friday 19 October 2018

\xa0

Applications must include a covering letter, resume and a completed employment application form including the details of 3 referees.

You're a meticulous bookkeeper who likes people and enjoys being part of a team and enjoys a variety of admin work.

Salary $55,000 - $65,000 p.a. PLUS super pro rata (depending on experience and skills)


Applications by Monday 15 October 2018 with the names and contact details of two professional referees addressed to: info@lgpro.com


Position Description


Title: Bookkeeper/Admin (P/T 0.6)


Organisational environment


LGPro is the peak body for Local Government professionals in Victoria. The organisation develops and delivers high quality professional development activities and services and represents the views of officers where this expert advice is required in the consultation process on legislation and policy and program development. LGPro is an independent, not for profit member organisation, however non-members access many of its activities and services.


Key responsibility areas


Primary responsibilities:


Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) the Bookkeeper/Admin will manage invoicing, payments, payroll and provide financial data to the Accountant to produce monthly financial statements.


The position will:


  • Be responsible for managing all day to day financial transactions, payroll and associated reporting
  • Manage and maintain reports required by the Accountant and external Auditor
  • Provide administrative support associated with our Programs and Events including registration
  • Contribute to maintaining the membership database
  • Other duties as directed


Organisational relationships


This position reports to the Chief Executive Officer. The position is required to work closely and positively with all staff, Board members, members and all other people involved with and in the work of LGPro.


Key skills and knowledge


  • Bookkeeper qualifications
  • Experience in MYOB
  • Experience working in general ledger reconciliations, bank reconciliations AP/AR, payroll, BAS/GST/PAYG preparations
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to liaise effectively at all levels with a wide range of people
  • Flexible, solution-oriented approach with ability to work under pressure with minimal supervision, independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks
  • Demonstrated ability and commitment to high quality customer service


Performance


Performance indicators will be determined.


They will revolve around:


  • Quality, accuracy and timelines of financial oversight and reporting
  • Meeting deadlines
  • Customer service
  • Contribution to the team

Corporate Affairs Manager

Company Name Mitsui & Co., Ltd. Company Location Melbourne CBD, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 101 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Corporate Affairs Manager | 12 mth contract | Professional team
  • Multi-site, international and cross-cultural communications/corporate affairs function
  • CBD Offices\xa0

\xa0

Are you are a skilled and experienced Corporate Affairs Manager? Join this professional and friendly team in a global multi-national company.

The Company

Mitsui & Co. (Australia) Ltd. is the wholly owned Australian subsidiary of Mitsui & Co., one of the world's most diversified trading, investment and services enterprises.


The Role

Mitsui & Co. Corporate Planning division is seeking a Corporate Affairs Manager to join their team for a period of 12 months with the possibility of extension. We are seeking an experienced Corporate Affairs Manager who has strong communication skills and able to think strategically. This role is responsible for the day-to-day corporate affairs function with broad ranging responsibilities for internal and external communications, public relations and research. A Corporate Affairs Manager will report to CAO & General Manager Corporate Planning Division.

The ideal candidate will have had Corporate Affairs/ Communication experience in a complex commercial environment. They will also possess a strong interpersonal skills to work in a cross-cultural organisation.


Key responsibilities in the role are:

  • Managing the organisation’s corporate affairs function which encompasses media relations, government relations, communications and research and analysis on the political and regulatory environment
  • Facilitating the company’s engagement with media, government and external stakeholders
  • Planning and executing corporate affairs strategy in consultation with the CAO & General Manager Corporate Planning Division
  • Preparing and writing media content, ensuring information accuracy and protection
  • Designing and maintaining the Oceania websites and Mitsui’s LinkedIn presence through regular updating of content, images and links.
  • Arranging and facilitating meetings for Senior Management with politicians and bureaucrats as required by Executive Management
  • Conducting research and analysis to identify issues in political and public policy areas that could impact the business
  • Maintaining existing and developing new relationships with media representatives
  • Undertaking domestic and international travel as required to progress projects and to share best practice


The Person

You will enjoy working within a successful team of talented individuals and bring your own proven experience to the division. You will bring to the role excellent written and verbal communication skills, knowledge of current media trends and ability to lead a corporate communications strategy. With an ability to co-ordinate and prioritize work you will have the following experience and skills:

  • A degree in a related field such as communications, journalism, or political science
  • 5 or more years in a communications or corporate affairs role preferably with in-house experience
  • Experience working in a B2B environment and in complex organisations
  • Experience managing third party service providers is preferred
  • Experience working in a cross-cultural environment is preferred
  • Strong understanding of media and news values and a good sense of what is ‘“newsworthy”
  • Ability to prepare various company media releases and corporate communications including speeches, statements and submissions that are high quality and accurate
  • Ability to think strategically and with foresight and to execute strategies
  • Ability to manage complex issues and exercise sound judgment
  • Strong communications skills and interpersonal skills to build effective relationships with journalists, the media and government representatives
  • Strong research, analysis and reporting skills
  • Strong time management skills and ability to work under pressure
  • Website design and maintenance skills is preferred
  • Understanding and interest of Japanese and Asian cultures is preferred
  • Written and spoken Japanese language skills are useful but not mandatory

\xa0

If you have the experience we are seeking, be sure to include your resume and a covering letter detailing your qualifications and experience.\xa0


Please Note:\xa0Only short listed candidates will be contacted. We thank you for your understanding with this decision.

Applications close COB 12 October 2018.

Full Time, 1 Year Fixed Term Contract\xa0

The College of Law is looking for a talented, dynamic Lecturers to join the team at our Office in Melbourne ,Victoria.

\xa0

Purpose of position

A lecturer is responsible for providing a high quality teaching and learning experience to students and for making ongoing contributions to the academic mission of the College in the areas of curriculum development, academic management and administration, research and scholarship and to the corporate life of the College in accordance with the College’s strategic goals.


The key areas the Lecturer will be involved in are:

  • Preparing for and conducting face to face and online programs
  • Mentoring students and assisting them to achieve prescribed learning outcomes
  • Conducting workshops, small group discussions, oral assessments, and other learning and assessment activities

Desirable

\xa0

If you are interested in being part of a growing Australia and New Zealand operation, then visit our website http://www.collaw.edu.au/careers/ for more information. Please send your application including a CV and cover letter to recruitment@collaw.edu.au.

Job description

About Nevro

Nevro (NYSE: NVRO) is a public multinational medical technology company headquartered in Redwood City, California. We have developed HF10™ therapy, an innovative, evidence-based neuromodulation platform.

We started with a simple mission to help more patients suffering from chronic pain. At each stage of development, our research was subject to the highest levels of scientific rigor, resulting in a new therapy that has impacted the lives of over 28,000 patients around the world.

The Nevro\xae Senza\xae SCS System received CE mark in 2010, TGA approval in 2011, FDA approval in 2015, and is commercially available in Europe, Australia, and the United States.

Overview

The Clinical Specialists provides technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, installation and maintenance of company products. Works with Sales Representatives to meet existing and potential clients (e.g., physicians, physician office groups at hospitals) to identify their clinical needs, goals, and constraints related to patient care and to discuss and demonstrate how company products can help them to achieve their goals and meet patient/client’s needs.
  • Promotes company products to current and potential customers within a defined region by providing clinical education of implant procedures and support for a variety of issues.
  • Serves as primary resource for clinical support including, but not limited to: troubleshooting, programming, and patient follow-up for company products.
  • May provide detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of client applications and solutions.
  • Responds to customer needs and complaints regarding products and service by developing creative and feasible solutions or working with other related personnel (e.g., sales, clinical, research, marketing, technical support) to develop optimal solutions.
  • Provides follow-up support to company sales staff and customer personnel by disseminating technical information on specific applications.
  • Trains and educates customers on the merits and proper clinical usage of company products by giving presentations and demonstrations using appropriate formats and platforms (e.g., slides, manuals, etc.) to keep customers abreast of new and existing products.
  • Typically attends and may oversee surgeries/implants in a clinical setting including labs and operation rooms of hospital accounts.
  • Perform patient follow-up to assure customer and patient success with the implanted products.
  • Develops and maintains business relationships with hospital personnel.
  • This position requires driving and travelling to visit customers.
  • In addition, the use of the telephone and keyboard on a daily basis.
  • Carrying company equipment on trips will include laptops, chargers, brochures, as well as study related equipment, i.e. programmers, coils.
  • Hospitals, operating rooms, clinics, surgical centers.
  • Experience in a consultative sales role a plus.
  • Travel 50-100% depending on relative locations of customers.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Role Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • This position requires over 50% travel.

Skills And Knowledge
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and influence relationships.
  • Analytical skills, including statistical analysis.
  • PC skills necessary (MS Office/Excel) and experience with sales force automation tools a plus.



  • Nevro offers equal employment opportunity, regardless of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, marital or family status, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression (including religious dress and grooming practices), gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth), physical or mental condition, protected veteran status, disability, age or other characteristics protected by laws.

    •

    Industry

    • Medical Devices
    • Biotechnology
    • Hospital & Health Care

    Employment Type

    Full-time

    Job Functions

    • Health Care Provider
    ]

Senior Compliance Officer

Permanent Full Time

Band 6 - $81,146 per annum plus superannuation

An opportunity exists in our Community Safety Department as a Senior Compliance Officer.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Include
  • To educate the community and promote responsible pet ownership whilst enforcing relevant legislation, regulations and Local laws.
  • To oversee the Compliance Team to ensure provision of compliance action by enforcing the relevant legislation, regulations, Local Laws and education of the community.
  • Provide leadership and support to the relevant Compliance Officers.

Demonstrated experience and proven ability to supervise and monitor staff to ensure service standards are met and maintained, whilst also having proven experience in regulatory, enforcement or a similar role are essential in undertaking this position.

Suitably qualified, your ability to work within a team environment, complete tasks within the specified timeframes, as well as excellent verbal and written communication skills, will ensure your success in this exciting position.

You will need to provide evidence of your right to work in Australia, certified copies of your qualifications, and a current Driver Licence. You must also be willing to provide a Pre-Employment Health Declaration and undertake a National Police Record Check.

Scientific Advisor- 12 month contract

Company Name GSK Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 127 views

Job description

Your Responsibilities

Our medical team is a high performing, engaged and collaborative group of people who are genuinely motivated by the impact that our products make to patient’s lives. We are looking for a Scientific Advisor to join our talented, close-knit and supportive team for a 12 month contract/secondment opportunity.

This role will provide medical and technical expertise to sales and marketing teams in the production, review and approval of promotional and non-promotional materials and activities and will contribute to the development and implementation of product strategy, and to training of commercial staff in the allocated disease area.

To be successful in this role you will have
  • Experience in a Scientific Advisor or similar role (Medical Affairs Associate or Product Specialist)
  • Knowledge of the Medicines Australia Code of Conduct and its application.
  • A degree in Science, Pharmacy or Pharmacology.
  • Pharmaceutical industry experience.
  • Clear and influential communication skills with the ability to work effectively with both medical and commercial stakeholders.
Experience of working with specialty medicines and/or in respiratory medicine would be an advantage.

This role represents a great chance to showcase your scientific expertise in a fast paced and varied environment and to be part of a global business that is focussed and committed to helping people to do more, feel better and live longer.

Why You?
A degree in Science, Pharmacy or Pharmacology.


Medicines Australia Code

Why GSK?
GlaxoSmithKline is a global research-based pharmaceutical company with a long and proud history in Australia. As an innovative pharmaceutical business, we rely on experts within our teams who come from a wide range of backgrounds working together towards our mission to help people feel better, do more and live longer.
